intro: Critesion cordobense, commonly known as the Cordoba grass, is a perennial herb native to South America, particularly Argentina. It is characterized by its tall, slender stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant typically grows in open, sunny areas such as grasslands and along riverbanks. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are arranged in spikelets, typical of the Poaceae family. Critesion cordobense is adapted to tolerate drought and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions.
